comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content:
The floatplane shows the Boeing C-700 (also identified as the CL-4S). Characteristic nose section with Hall-Scott L-4 engine, double radiators in inverted V-form standing right up from the side of the fuselage. Twin float construction, no emergency floats at the underside of the wingtips. Two-bay wing with a heavy dihedral. Two-seater in tandem. 
This machine was used by Mr. Boeing and Edward Hubbard to inaugurate the first International Contract Air Masil Service between Seattle and Victoria, British Columbia, on March 3, 1919.

More information in Peter M. Bowers. Boeing aircraft since 1916.
